intro: Hymenocyclus framesii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Hymenocyclus framesii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
